definition: Dokdo (Japanese Takeshima 竹島|竹岛[Zhu2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan

sentences.english: If the weather is no problem, these members will arrive the afternoon of Dokdo.
sentences.chinese: 如果气候没有问题，当天下午这些议员就将到达独岛。

sentences.english: It is no wonder Japan and South Korea have taken tough stances because they both want the rich resources of Dokdo.
sentences.chinese: 也难怪日韩皆立场强硬，希望得到独岛的丰富资源。

sentences.english: Historical context is crucial to assessing the Dokdo issue.
sentences.chinese: 在评估独岛问题上，历史是关键。

sentences.english: The essence of sovereignty of Dokdo is the dispute for territory between Korea and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 独岛领有权问题的实质是韩日间领土争端问题。

sentences.english: Erica:Wow, then the Japanese must love Dokdo.
sentences.chinese: 哇，那日本人应该很爱独岛了。

sentences.english: Japan insists Dokdo should be called “Takeshima”.
sentences.chinese: 日本坚称独岛应该叫“竹岛”。

definition: Diaoyu Islands, claimed by China but controlled by Japan as the Senkaku Islands, also called the Pinnacle Islands
Kuril Islands, archipelago in Sakhalin, far-eastern Russia
Yeonpyeong island on Yellow Sea coast of Korea
Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
Ryukyu Islands/Okinawa 沖繩|冲绳[Chong1 sheng2] and other islands of modern Japan
the Japanese side or party (in negotiations etc)
Tsushima Island, between Japan and South Korea
Sejong the Great or Sejong Daewang (1397-1450), reigned 1418-1450 as fourth king of Joseon or Chosun dynasty, in whose reign the hangeul alphabet was invented
